definition: to fall/to drop/to decline/to deteriorate/to go downhill
mourning garments
to decline/to wane/to become weak or feeble
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: The author analyses the historical decline reasons of Qutan Temple from five aspects.
sentences.chinese: 笔者拟从五个方面分析瞿昙寺衰落的历史原因。

sentences.english: Does it mean the fall of a brand icon?
sentences.chinese: 这是否意味着思域品牌的衰落？

sentences.english: As the decline of its character, like cherry blossoms in Japan, and belong to a very bad Sheng.
sentences.chinese: 它的衰落如同日本的樱花性格一样，属于盛极而衰。

sentences.english: Roman empire, Brirish Empire all declined.
sentences.chinese: 罗马帝国，大英帝国都衰落了。

sentences.english: Now you can get the declination of the sun with the next formula.
sentences.chinese: 现在，你就可以得到衰落的太阳与未来的公式。

sentences.english: Several heads were symbolic of decadence and oppression, and also of heresy.
sentences.chinese: 几个头是象征性的衰落和压迫，和并且异端邪说。

sentences.english: In Asia and America it has become fashionable to look upon these failings with disdain.
sentences.chinese: 在亚洲和美国，不屑一顾于欧洲的衰落已经蔚然成风。

sentences.english: Meticulous heavy color painting will emerge in the painting later gradually moves toward the decline.
sentences.chinese: 工笔重彩画在文人画兴起以后逐步走向衰落。

sentences.english: But in the U.S., affluence did not lead to indulgence and decline.
sentences.chinese: 但是，在美国，富裕并没有使它走向放纵与衰落。

sentences.english: During the middle ages, Greek civilization declined and became effete.
sentences.chinese: 中世纪，古希腊文明开始衰落，一蹶不振。

sentences.english: Is India's computer-services industry heading for a fall?
sentences.chinese: 印度的电脑服务产业正在走向衰落吗？

sentences.english: Some crimes, like domestic violence, have increased with the rotten economy.
sentences.chinese: 类似家庭暴力这类的犯罪随着经济的衰落反而增多。

sentences.english: Ms Perez links each financial innovation to its own booms and busts.
sentences.chinese: 佩雷斯把每项金融创新和其自我繁荣衰落联系起来。

sentences.english: And there’s nothing ramshackle about Mauritius.
sentences.chinese: 而且毛里求斯没有衰落的迹象。

sentences.english: It has been a spectacular rise and fall for Japan.
sentences.chinese: 日本的崛起和衰落都是这么轰轰烈烈。

sentences.english: After the War of Resistance Against Japan broke out, the thought of quintessence of Chinese traditional music declined rapidly too.
sentences.chinese: 抗战全面爆发后，国粹主义音乐思潮也迅速走向衰落。

definition: to decline/to wane/to decay/to deteriorate
to decline/to wane
to decline/to die out/decline and fall
to flourish/to thrive
to decline/to wane/weakened/enfeebled/in decline
uninspired/dejected/discouraged
to rise abruptly (to a towering position)/to tower over/to spring up/to emerge suddenly/the emergence (e.g. of a power)
to die out/to wither away
(literary) to decline/to wane/title of a section in the Book of Songs 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1]
rivers pour away by the day (idiom); going from bad to worse/deteriorating day by day
from prosperity to decline/at its peak before the decline
all the rage for a time/grand fashion for a limited time
to rise suddenly/to grow vigorously
to decline/to fall/to drop/to falter/a decline/recession (in economics)
to go downhill/to decline/to slump
(of status or wealth) to decline/(of buildings etc) to become dilapidated/run-down/(of plants) to wilt
